beer.beer_description:
We’re back brewing with our mates Fast Fashion from Seattle, 2 years on from our first collaboration Business class and again using their truly one of a kind hop.

Matt from Fast Fashion fell in love with experimental variety 24B-05 the moment he sniffed it, due to its truly unique profile. Soon after buying the proprietary rights and giving it the equally unique name: Anchovy.

Last time we brewed a West Coast IPA with his hops, they took a much cushier journey than this year’s batch, that found their way over from Seattle, smuggled in some carry-on luggage thanks to a daring and sly friend of the brewery who shall go unnamed...

Air Ann aims to show off what Anchovy can do in the hazy variety of IPA’s. We paired it up with Simcoe and Mosaic to coax out its inherent qualities and we’re left with a smooth hazy that doesn’t hide its watermelon bubblegum, lemon hard candy, pine and raspberry notes.

items.badge_description: What happens when you take two or more amazing breweries, throw them into the tank and let them ferment together? An amazing collaboration beer, that’s what! Cheers to working together to create the perfect flavor. That's 260 different beers that have been brewed as a collaboration.  Try 5 more for Level 53!

items.badge_description: Do you come from the land down under, where beer does flow, and men chunder? That's at least 110 different beers from Australia. Try 5 more for Level 23.

items.checkin_comment: Anchovy hops!  Maybe my first one. Unique. I don't get the watermelon bubblegum thing. Delicious.

user.bio: Let's talk about beer. Where were you brewed?? Mmmmm, beer.

items.comment: Are you in the Land of the Rising Sun ☀️

user.bio: Let's talk about beer. Where were you brewed?? Mmmmm, beer.

items.comment: Glenn P. Yessir! Had fun on a long weekend in Tokyo.

user.bio: Its not about me - its about the beer.
UT Moderator, Craft beer nut. Love the hops, love the darks, love the travelling and hanging out with beery people!

beer.beer_description:
We’re back brewing with our mates Fast Fashion from Seattle, 2 years on from our first collaboration Business class and again using their truly one of a kind hop.

Matt from Fast Fashion fell in love with experimental variety 24B-05 the moment he sniffed it, due to its truly unique profile. Soon after buying the proprietary rights and giving it the equally unique name: Anchovy.

Last time we brewed a West Coast IPA with his hops, they took a much cushier journey than this year’s batch, that found their way over from Seattle, smuggled in some carry-on luggage thanks to a daring and sly friend of the brewery who shall go unnamed...

Air Ann aims to show off what Anchovy can do in the hazy variety of IPA’s. We paired it up with Simcoe and Mosaic to coax out its inherent qualities and we’re left with a smooth hazy that doesn’t hide its watermelon bubblegum, lemon hard candy, pine and raspberry notes.

items.badge_description:
The beer style with the most annual check-ins definitely deserves its own party, don’t you think?

In 2023, Sierra Nevada had the brilliant idea to create a day of celebration for hazies, and we gotta tip our cap to their brilliant idea! 

This year, we’re excited to introduce our second iteration of the Hazy IPA Day badge.

Do you come from the land down under, where beer does flow, and men chunder? That's at least 50 different beers from Australia. Try 5 more for Level 11.

items.badge_description: Canning is all the rage and it's not hard to see why - travels well, more environmentally friendly, and no need to carry your bottle opener. That's 115 checkins with the serving style of Can. Try 5 more for Level 24! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

You may not be able to see through the haze, but that juicy, hoppy goodness goes down smooth. What started as a trend is here to stay. That's 80 different beers with the style of IPA - New England / Hazy, Pale Ale - New England / Hazy, IPA - Milkshake, or Pale Ale - Milkshake. Try 5 more for Level 17!
